title: Drawing, "Chalice"
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite
markings: Recto and Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Vertical rectangle. The foot is decorated with cherubim above festoons. The stem has the shape of a baluster upon a convex twisted pedestal. Around the lower part of the shaft is a band with circular medallions. The bowl is decorated with a leaf calyx and a row of acanthus calices supporting with the upper scrolls a festoon. Dark colored background.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Chalice".
Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-949.
